references.paper_title: NeRF: Representing scenes as neural radiance fields for view synthesis
references.reason: This foundational paper introduced NeRFs, a highly influential technique that represents scenes as neural radiance fields.  Its impact is widespread throughout the field of computer vision and robotics, setting the stage for many of the subsequent advancements in neural field-based 3D scene representation.  It directly influenced numerous other NeRF-based and Neural Field-based robotics papers.

references.paper_title: Occupancy Networks: Learning 3D reconstruction in function space
references.reason: This paper introduced Occupancy Networks, a significant contribution to implicit neural representations. Occupancy Networks directly address the problem of representing the occupancy of 3D space in a continuous manner, laying the groundwork for numerous applications in robotics, including scene reconstruction and object detection.

references.paper_title: DeepSDF: Learning continuous signed distance functions for shape representation
references.reason: This paper introduced DeepSDF, a method for representing shapes as continuous signed distance functions (SDFs). The ability to learn continuous SDFs directly from data has profound implications for various robotics tasks, including shape reconstruction, object manipulation, and robot navigation.

references.paper_title: iNeRF: Inverting neural radiance fields for pose estimation
references.reason: This paper presented iNeRF, a method for inverting pre-trained NeRFs to estimate camera poses.  iNeRF demonstrated the utility of NeRFs for pose estimation, opening up new possibilities for camera localization and robot navigation. The ability to invert NeRFs enabled efficient pose estimation and facilitated applications in robotics where accurate pose information is crucial.

references.paper_title: NeRF--: Neural radiance fields without known camera parameters
references.reason: This paper proposed NeRF--, a method for training NeRFs without requiring known camera poses.  This advancement significantly reduced the need for extensive manual calibration or accurate camera pose estimation, thereby making NeRFs more accessible and applicable for real-world robotics applications. It represents a major step towards more practical use of NeRFs in robotic settings.

references.paper_title: Instant neural graphics primitives with a multiresolution hash encoding
references.reason: This paper introduced Instant Neural Graphics Primitives (Instant NGP), which significantly accelerated NeRF training and rendering. Instant NGP's efficiency made real-time applications of NeRFs feasible, pushing the boundaries of NeRFs in robotics and opening doors for real-time scene understanding and environment modeling.

references.paper_title: Distilled feature fields enable few-shot language-guided manipulation
references.reason: This paper introduced Distilled Feature Fields (DFFs), integrating language models with 3D feature fields for robot manipulation.  DFFs demonstrated the power of combining large language models with neural fields for complex robotics tasks requiring semantic understanding, opening up avenues for natural language control of robots.

references.paper_title: LERF: Language embedded radiance fields
references.reason: LERF demonstrated a groundbreaking integration of language models and radiance fields for robotics tasks. LERF enables robots to understand and respond to natural language instructions related to scene understanding and task execution, expanding the capabilities of neural fields and bridging the gap between natural language and robotic actions.

references.paper_title: NeRF-RPN: A general framework for object detection in NeRFs
references.reason: NeRF-RPN presented a novel framework for object detection using neural radiance fields.  This work directly addressed the challenge of object recognition in 3D scenes represented by NeRFs, demonstrating the potential of NeRFs for object-centric tasks like grasping and manipulation in robotics.

references.paper_title: BundleSDF: Neural 6-DoF tracking and 3D reconstruction of unknown objects
references.reason: BundleSDF extended the capabilities of neural fields to robustly track and reconstruct 3D shapes of unknown objects in real-time.  This is crucial for robot manipulation, which often involves interacting with objects whose geometry and pose are not initially known.  The real-time capability is essential for interactive robot tasks.

references.paper_title: GaussianGrasper: 3D language Gaussian splatting for open-vocabulary robotic grasping
references.reason: This work introduced GaussianGrasper, a method for open-vocabulary robotic grasping using 3D Gaussian splatting and natural language. GaussianGrasper demonstrated the ability of neural fields to handle objects with varying shapes and appearances, using only language instructions.  This represents a significant step towards general-purpose robotic manipulation.

references.paper_title: D-NeRF: Neural Radiance Fields for Dynamic Scenes
references.reason: This paper extended NeRFs to handle dynamic scenes, a crucial step for applications in robotics where dynamic environments are common. D-NeRF addressed the challenge of representing time-varying scenes and improved the accuracy and robustness of NeRFs in realistic situations.

references.paper_title: Dynamic 3D Gaussians: Tracking by persistent dynamic view synthesis
references.reason: This work extended Gaussian splatting to handle dynamic scenes. It provided a method for tracking objects and reconstructing dynamic scenes by introducing a time component to Gaussian splatting.  This significantly improves the realism and applicability of the model for real-world robot applications.

references.paper_title: PAC-NeRF: Physics augmented continuum neural radiance fields for geometry-agnostic system identification
references.reason: PAC-NeRF incorporated physics into the NeRF framework, leading to more realistic simulations.  This is crucial for robotics as it allows robots to better understand and interact with their physical environment.   Physics-based simulations are vital for training robots that need to manipulate or navigate within the real world.

references.paper_title: PhysGaussian: Physics-integrated 3D Gaussians for generative dynamics
references.reason: PhysGaussian integrated physics directly into the Gaussian splatting framework for dynamic scene representation.  This allows for generating more realistic and physically plausible dynamic simulations, enhancing the applicability of the model for robotics tasks that require understanding and interacting with physical phenomena.

references.paper_title: Neural scene graphs for dynamic scenes
references.reason: This work addressed the challenge of representing dynamic scenes using neural scene graphs. This improves the ability of robots to operate in complex scenes with multiple moving objects and enhances their ability to plan and execute actions in such environments.

references.paper_title: MARS: An instance-aware, modular and realistic simulator for autonomous driving
references.reason: MARS introduced a highly realistic and modular simulator for autonomous driving based on NeRFs.  This simulator enables more robust testing and evaluation of autonomous driving systems, accelerating the development of safer and more reliable autonomous vehicles.

references.paper_title: UniSim: A neural closed-loop sensor simulator
references.reason: UniSim is a neural sensor simulator capable of creating realistic multi-sensor data for autonomous driving, enabling more robust testing and development. The ability to generate realistic sensor data is essential for improving the reliability and safety of autonomous systems in various scenarios.

references.paper_title: NeO 360: Neural fields for sparse view synthesis of outdoor scenes
references.reason: NeO 360 demonstrated the ability to reconstruct high-quality 360° scenes from limited views, showing the potential of neural fields for creating realistic and detailed representations of outdoor environments. This is crucial for mobile robotics, autonomous driving, and other applications involving outdoor navigation.

references.paper_title: Neural Groundplans: Persistent neural scene representations from a single image
references.reason: Neural Groundplans extended NeRFs to create persistent scene representations from limited views, addressing the challenge of representing large-scale environments. The ability to efficiently represent large scenes using neural fields is vital for mobile robotics and autonomous driving applications.
